summary: The Taiwan Allies Fund Act aims to bolster Taiwan's international standing and support countries that maintain or strengthen ties with Taiwan against pressure from the People's Republic of China. It authorizes $40 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2028 to fund initiatives like health projects, civil society support, supply chain diversification, and Taiwan's participation in international fora.  The Secretary of State will oversee implementation, coordinating with relevant agencies and ensuring coordination and, as appropriate, cost-sharing with Taiwan. Annual reports to Congress are required to assess activities and funding.
